intro: Pauia belladonna, commonly known as the deadly nightshade, is a toxic plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other toxic and economically important plants. The plant features dark green, oval-shaped leaves and produces bell-shaped, purple flowers. Its berries are bright red and highly poisonous, containing tropane alkaloids. Despite its toxicity, it has been historically used in traditional Māori medicine for specific purposes.
